history.content: You should wait until your instructor gets back to you on this, probably within the next couple weeks.

children.subject: Bring this up with your instructor!

Hi Michelle, OP here. So I've spoken with several people.

First, I spoke with the instructor, who said it was possible to get units. But we didn't discuss it further cause we're busy with finals.

Second, I synced up with the GSI coordinator, who told me to talk to MDS and Prof Garcia about units for CS 399 (Teaching for Units).

So, lastly, I made a thread with both of them, explaining my situation (I have a 30 hr/wk assignment). Prof Garcia told me that you need to do 40 hrs/wk to get 2 units. I was given the option of doing more lab assisting, or doing work outside the GSI umbrella. We synced up with the instructor, and came to the agreement that I'd help develop a project before the course starts for 0.5 units. (I already get 1.5 for my 30 hour deal).

Let me know if you have more questions!

OP, were you able to find a resolution to your problem? I am also planning on TA'ing (and taking CS 375 but course credit is postponed until fall) in addition to a 4-unit course, so I would also like to hit that 6-unit threshold.

history.content:
Hi,

I'm currently enrolled in a 3 unit and 4 unit course for summer. I need the 4 unit course to graduate. The 3 unit course is only so I hit the 6 unit minimum for financial aid.

I received my financial aid package and it covers all the costs for 7 units and then some.

However, I also received an offer to GSI, and would prefer that over the 3 unit course. Is it possible to receive 2 units from TA'ing to hit the financial aid minimum?

I have heard that one shouldn't take summer units for teaching because you have to "pay" for them. However, in this case, I think financial aid will cover all the units I take.

I've also taken CS 375 so I can't use those units.

Thank you!
history.subject: Summer TA for Financial Aid Units?
